MASTER_PAD_VERSION_INFO.MASTER_PAD_INFO: Portable Application Description, or PAD for short, is a data set that is used by shareware authors to disseminate information to anyone interested in their software products. To find out more go to http://www.asp-shareware.org/pad

Program_Info.Program_System_Requirements: MDAC 2.8, Microsoft Access 97, 2000, 2002 (aka XP) or 2003; .NET Framework v1.1

English.Char_Desc_45: Compare and update Access database backends
English.Char_Desc_80: Compare and update Access database backends with SSW Data Renovator
English.Char_Desc_250: SSW Data Renovator generates difference reports that identify the structural differences between any two backend mdb files.
English.Char_Desc_450:
Compare and update Access database backends with SSW Data Renovator
If youve got client backend mdb files that are out of sync with the master version, let SSW Data Renovator generate different reports for you to make the changes manually. Or step through the wizard and the data will be automatically moved into the new structure. Once in sync, use SSW Data PRO! to keep them that way.
English.Char_Desc_2000:
Compare and update Access database backends with SSW Data Renovator
If youve got client backend mdb files that are out of sync with the master version, let SSW Data Renovator generate different reports for you to make the changes manually. Or step through the wizard and the data will be automatically moved into the new structure. Once in sync, use SSW Data PRO! to keep them that way.
Use SSW Data Renovator instead of documenting and remembering changes made to your data structure. It analyses your database and works out the differences. Even if you don't have access to the current structure you can have the differences written to a table. Use SSW Data PRO! to commit the changes automatically (which in great in deployment!)
